title: 120-A
statement: A. Elevatortime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputinput.txtoutputoutput.txtA sky scraper with 1000 floors has been built in the city of N. It has modern superfast elevators to help to travel from one floor to another. Each elevator has two doors, the front one and the back one. If one goes in through the front door, he goes out through the back one and vice versa. The elevator has two rails numbered with numbers 1 and 2. Rail 1 is located to the left of the entrance to the front door (or correspondingly, to the right of the entrance to the back door). Rail 2 is located opposite it, to the right of the entrance to the front door and to the left of the entrance to the back door. We know that each person in the city of N holds at a rail with the strongest hand.One day a VIP person visited the city and of course, he took a look at the skyscraper and took a ride in the elevator. We know the door through which he entered and the rail he was holding at. Now we need to determine as soon as possible whether he is left-handed or right-handed.InputThe first line indicates the door through which the very important person entered the elevator. It contains"front"if the person enters the elevator through the front door and"back"if he entered the elevator through the back door. The second line contains integera(1 ≤a≤ 2) which denotes the number of the rail at which the person was holding.OutputPrint character"R"if the VIP is right-handed or"L"if he is left-handed.ExamplesInputfront1OutputL

processed.result:
An elevator has two doors (front and back) and two rails (numbered 1 and 2).  Rail 1 is to the left of the front door and rail 2 is to the right of the front door.  

A person entered the elevator through either the front or back door and was holding onto one of the rails. 

Given the door the person entered through and the rail they were holding, determine if the person is left-handed or right-handed.

* If the person entered through the front door and was holding rail 1, they are left-handed.
* If the person entered through the front door and was holding rail 2, they are right-handed.
* If the person entered through the back door and was holding rail 1, they are right-handed.
* If the person entered through the back door and was holding rail 2, they are left-handed.

A person entered an elevator through either the front or back door. They held onto one of two rails. Determine if the person is left-handed or right-handed based on the door they entered and the rail they held.
